Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Puja L
Reviews.Content: Burckin Suites has the best location if you are looking to do sightseeing in the Sultanahmet area. All the monuments and grand bazaar are a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The tram which takes you to Taksom square is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The room was cozy, clean. The hotel staff {thanks to Sedat:) } were extremely friendly and helped us with directions and timing of different monuments. The rooftop has some of the best views of Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Lalitha B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was organised by our travel agent and very happy with the choice. It was strategically located as all the landmarks and restaurants were in walking distance from the hotel. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very courteous and helpful. The buffet breakfast on the roof top was fantastic with the amazing views of Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia in the background. Would definitely recommend this hotel for your stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: adopted_key
Reviews.Content: definitely one of the finest hotels in Istanbul Beautiful rooms, great location, friendly staff highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel You Can Rely on!!!”
Reviews.Author: lullaby x
Reviews.Content: The Burckin Hotel lies in a good position. It will take 10 minutes walk to Istanbul University, the Grand Bazaart, the Blue Mosque and the Saint Sophia Church. On March 19, 2012, we chose this hotel for our last night staying in Istanbul for its kind and sincere staff and the proper price which macth well with its service. Important to mention that, there is a staff named Sadat He is very kind and we've got a lot of help from him. He also helped us to find a taxi to the airport in local price. We are very greatful for the kind action. The next time I go to Istanbul, I believe I will choose this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: marina187147
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, very very charming. It's really clean and the stuff is allways there with a big smiley for your help, i can't wait to go back !!!

Reviews.Title: “22-27.February 2012”
Reviews.Author: Wladex
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with excellent position, kind staff, clean and comfortable rooms

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel from which to visit a magical city”
Reviews.Author: Ismail123
Reviews.Content: I cannot readily put into words what a wonderful stay we had in this magical city and at this delightful hotel. The Burckin Hotel is walking distance from all the main historic attractions. With three small children travelling is never easy, but the staff were warm & welcoming and very attentive to our needs. We look forward to returning to Istanbul and I feel that the Burckin Hotel is the ideal base from which to enjoy an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: moscowgirl55
Reviews.Content: We just spent four nights at the Burckin in Istanbul. We were picked up from airport and checked in effortlessly. The location is great, minutes away from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and the Grand Bazaar and plenty of shops and restaurants close by, including a wonderful book shop on Divan Yolo with every book thats ever been written on Turkey in English! We had nothing but positive experiences and conversations with everyone we met. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful, the breakfasts were varied and tasty. Try the white cheese on bread with honey mmmm! The room was small but very comfortable and clean. Fabulous roof terrace overlooking Blue Mosque etc, but a bit chilly in February! We would use the hotel again for its comfort and location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great staff & lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: TimdeKnegt
Reviews.Content: We got to Istanbul quite early in the morning, and were very quickly assisted by the host, Sedat. The check in procedure did not take any longer than 5 minutes. The lounger area has been very tastefully decorated. The rooms are very nicely done, and a good quality. We did not spend too much time in the room, but everything necessary was available. During our stay we were very well taken care off by Sedat, who ensured that our stay was pleasant and that we would have a great time. The breakfast is the morning is good. However, do make sure that you get in at the right time. If you get downstairs at rushtime, you might have to wait a few minutes before you can sit down. The location of the hotel is amazing, and right in the centre. It's a short stroll from the Blue mosque, hagia sofia, little hagia sofia, grand bazaar & topkapi. Make sure that you see the roof terrace. Even though it had been snowing while we were in Istanbul, the views were stunning. I have already recommended this hotel to friends and family, and we will most certainly return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Curlito
Reviews.Content: We paid 68â‚¬ per night and everything was perfect with our stay. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Aker12
Reviews.Content: Burckin Hotel is an excellent hotel to stay in to see the main attractions of Istanbul. Situated in Sultanahmet, it is a central point to travel to and from grand bazaar, hagia Sofia mosque, Sultanahmet mosque, basilica cistern to name a few. Excellent access to public transport especially if travelling from the airport. The hotel staff are friendly and fantastic, they are happy to help you with any concerns or travel issues. The hotel itself has a ottoman feel to it, bedrooms are clean and modern fully equipped with necessaties. Great atmosphere, overall I recommend anyone to stay here and look forward to returning to this hotel when I next arrive in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money. Great lockation”
Reviews.Author: erietta
Reviews.Content: With a 65euros per night for a double room, this hotel is value for money! Clean, friendly, on a great lockation ! very close to Agya Sofia and the tram. A great room with all amenities you need. The breakfast could be a bit more european!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: monguillet b
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central just close to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. The people in the hotel are very helpful and kind. It' not an hotel where you'll go for honeymoon but for tourism with friends or family it's perfect !

Reviews.Title: “A real jewel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah D
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed in this delightful hotel for our last night in Istanbul, a last-minute deal, and we were totally charmed. It was wonderfully central--an easy walk to the Blue Mosque and a bit further to Topkapi. We had 3 adjoining rooms which were small but beautifully appointed, and especially enjoyed the excellent shower! The staff brought wine and fruit while we waited, and most of them spoke excellent English. They were most helpful making a lovely dinner recommendation as well as the reservation. The price was a real steal at 100 euros per room, and it included a copious breakfast. We were allowed to leave our bags in a secure place after checking out until we needed to cllect them for our return flights.. The staff was always friendly and most helpful. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent”
Reviews.Author: Timi1ro
Reviews.Content: Exellent location. The roof bar is a plus, 24 hours open. The rooms are small but enough for 2 or 3 nights. Ask for higher floors in order to have day light.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a very good area. Very near from Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Lobby is narrow but nicely arranged. The room with Balcony is very very small. Extremely narrow and crowded. It is almost occupied by the bed. TV screen is small and was not working. AC is good. Bathroom is not bad. It is not good for a family as every floor is smelly with cigarrettes smell. It was so strong in my room in the sixth floor and my family room in the second floor. We opened the windows and sprayed perfume but the small was so bad. Reception staff was not smiling and tough as if giving orders when talking. Really not professional for this type of service expected from such a hotel. Other staff including administrators where more nice. Breakfast was simple and of limited varieties but was enough. I would not recommend this hotel for family stay and definitely will avoid it next time!

Reviews.Title: “Burcking Hotel needs to clean their pipes”
Reviews.Author: Kit C
Reviews.Content: It was difficult to miss the smell emanating from the room bathroom. I had to sleep with the window open both nights. The hotel managment's solution was to come up and spray perfume in the room and bathroom. Mine was not the only room. Met several travellers who had asked to move rooms for the same reason.

Reviews.Title: “Good location hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan M
Reviews.Content: Perfect location if you want to explore Istanbul (Blue Mosque, Haga Sofia etc). Friendly staaf which helps you with arrangements, thoughâ€¦it is probably cheaper to make arrangements through Tourist information. Breakfirst is ok - everything you need but not first-rate. Nice rooms in modern style. Located near Tramway Station "Sultanahmet", which makes it easy to go and from Airport. From the Airport Havalimani Ataturk - just take the Metro to end station "Aksaray". Then walk between Metro and Tramway. Take Tramway in direction "Kabatas" and jump off at "Sultanahmet". Walk back in the same direction you came with Tramway, second street to the left (just after two ATM) turn left and furher down this street on the right hand you will find the hotel (iron and glas door leading down to reception).

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Turtlegrace
Reviews.Content: A great first experience in Istanbul. I originally checked into a less than satisfactory hotel nearby and wanted to switch the next night. They had a room and were so kind to my parents who were visiting. The staff was great and when we decided to stay an extra night they didn't have a room but found us a suitable hotel nearby and carried all of our things there in the rain. We live in Ankara and now always suggest the Burckin for anyone that visits Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Nancy2525
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights at this hotel in early December and had an excellent experience. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, the breakfasts were all well prepared and varied each day, the location is excellent, the rooms were clean and of adequate size and the price was moderate. The Burckin Hotel is not five star luxury; but, it is a really nice place with lots of appealing character and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful days in Burckin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marilita-Fenia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Burckin Suites from 01.12 - 04.12. Boutique hotel we great stuff, interesting rooms, clean and with great view! We stayed in 502 room and from our window we overlooked Hagia Sophia monument.. If we ever visit again Instabul Burckin Suites will be our choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Svevlad”
Reviews.Author: SvevladH
Reviews.Content: Staying in Burckin Hotel from 29.11.-03.12. for my wife and mee will remain a wonderful memories.Small but comfortable hotel with more than courteous personnel contributed to fall in love at first sight, the beautiful and interesting in Istanbul. Already, we are thinking about re-visiting Istanbul and of course Burckin. I sincerely recommend Burckin all future visitors to Istanbul. Svevlad - Sarajevo

Reviews.Title: “I'll definitely choose this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Olga N
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very easy to get from the Ataturk airport by public transport . Perfectly located in the very historical centre. Attentive, polite and hospitable staff. When coming to Istanbul next time I'll definitely choose this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ElenaBrini
Reviews.Content: The location is just perfect, walking distance from all the main attractions. Stuff very helpful and friendly, the Hotel is new, comfortable and has a beautiful terrace. Free wireless internet works perfectly. Breakfast is ok. Room has all the amenities, and very well decorated. Very quiet. Highly recommend it I did like almost everything, the room was clean and reasonable however quite small.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Artem A
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel. Comfortable and clean rooms, very helpful and courteous staff. Breakfasts are absolutely match the level of the hotel. WiFi worked fine in all points of the hotel. Location is very convenient, all within walking distance, near a tram stop. Everyone was extremely pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and efficient”
Reviews.Author: Lotuslife
Reviews.Content: Burckin Suites is in the heart of Sultanhamet in Istanbul about 30 minutes from Ataturk Airport. The hotel has around 40 rooms that are clean and comfortable with safe, mini bar and room service available. Staff are very helpful and kind, even realising it was my birthday and providing compliemntary wine and fruit. The nearest tram stop is 2 minutues walk and shops and restaurants are close by and plentiful. It is easy to get to the major sites on foot while the Bosphorous and other parts of the city are accesible within minutes by tram. Istanbul is a fabulous city and next time I visit I will definitely stay at Burckin Suites.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay in a fascinating city”
Reviews.Author: teachinjos
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner in a room with balcony views of Aghia Sophia. We found the hotel perfect in all respects. Helpful staff, immaculate rooms and above all a perfect location. The hotel is in a quiet street just metres from the tram stop , with Aghia Sophia and Topkapi a short stroll away. We booked a taxi pick-up from the airport through the hotel and everything worked perfectly. I also thought the room rate for the hotel was was very reasonable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The One!”
Reviews.Author: ranissima
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, I am so glad i stayed here. This is my second trip to Istanbul, the first one i stayed with my husband at Antik Hotel which was far off in Beyazit and this time I travelled with my mom and i needed to stay at a Hotel closer to the main attractions, and boy am I glad i chose Burckin, it was spot on. The hotel is on a quiet side street, yet few minutes walk to everything, really few minutes. The staff is very friendly. The room which included a full set of shampoos, gel wash, bathroom, slippers, etc... was a bit small but not a big deal. The breakfast wasnt extravagant but also not a big deal. We had a smooth transportation from/to Sabiha Gocken Airport. After 2 trips to Istanbul I have to admit that I love staying in Sultanahmet and will definitely be back at the Burckin Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: filoxeniaGreece
Reviews.Content: We are still in Istanbul.The hotel is very well located,close to all major attractions,and to the tram. The only dark point is the size of the rooms.Other than that it is clean,reasonable and the staff is excellent . Do experience the hamams.There are two nearby definitely worth the visit. The area is not the best for food.The Taksim is more the case in my opinion.Have fun

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Abdullah E
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located among all major attractions Sultanahmet has to offer. The rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. The hotel staff very friendly and helpful:) Thanks alot

Reviews.Title: “Excellence staff and central location”
Reviews.Author: Dougdog
Reviews.Content: We booked the Burckin Hotel because it seemed to offer excellent value and judging by the reviews was very close to some of the main sights of Istanbul. The hotel rooms are modern, comfortable and clean. The bathrooms, as has been mentioned before, are on the small side (particularly the shower space) but were perfectly adequate for our needs. The hotel is indeed very close to the main sights and the view from the roof terrace was quite amazing. We had one minor problem with our room (it was clear that something was up with the drains) but when we spoke to the staff they were extremely obliging and found us a new room very quickly. The only thing I would recommend the hotel provide is some information in the room about e.g. when (or if) the roof terrace is open, that there is a small smoking area for guests (if required) and some details about the TV channels (there were a 1000+ channels, but no guide, so to find one in your language could take a while unless you were lucky). Overall, this is a great hotel which offered value for money, good customer service and a wonderful view. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ace Service”
Reviews.Author: Patricia T
Reviews.Content: Superb location for tourist spots,restaurants and easy walking to Grand Bazaar.Rooms are minimalist and the hotel's name takes a bit of practice (remember Butch as in Cassidy) but otherwise zero complaints.Above all the staff were genuinely friendly and extremely helpful.We returned for a second bite of this cherry at the end of our holiday.Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for visiting istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Adel2011
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to istanbul, the hotel was super clean and comfortable, the location was perfect in the middle of the touristic area with a very nice staff and a very good breakfast. In my next visit I have to check Burkin Hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: NIcoleta F
Reviews.Content: Very good location, central in down town in a silent street, excellent start point for visiting Istanbul major touristic places. Rooms not so big but very clean and confortable. Breackfast was good. Staff very friendly and helpful but never invasive. Very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant journay”
Reviews.Author: jawaher a
Reviews.Content: the hotel location was exellent. the staff were very very frindly Iliked them all and felt as family between them .we were in the fourth floor and the A/C was excellent which is not the case in other hotel in sultanahmed area.. the cleanless of the hotel was excellent .and i hope the hotel maintain this level. Ialready told the adminstration to provide some room with twin bed, in general it was anice tripe ,

Reviews.Title: “nice stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lstnlft
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff. Hotel is close to almost everything you need to see in Istanbul. Breakfast was the best we had during our visit in Turkey. Room was small, but very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Pavel-akshan Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel is absolutely marvelous! it is located right in the center of Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, so you get full access to Sultan Ahmet Mosque (aka the Blue Mosque) and Aya Sofia! Tram station is just few meters away, so you needÂ´t travel by taxi all the time. The Grand Bazaar, Yerebatan Cistern, Topkapi - all those interesting places of Istanbul are located not far from the hotel. Needless to mention lots of cafÃ©s and shops on Divan Yoglu street... The staff is very friendly and ready to help you 24/7! Room size can seem a bit small to some people, but we only spent nights at the hotel so it did not matter at all. IÂ´d like also to mention that the hotel has a great roof terrace with breathtaking view! I would highly recommend this hotel to those visiting Istanbul first time!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Roger726
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with this hotel. It is in a quiet street and the famous sightseeings are just around the corner. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and nice. Great view at the Haghia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Bosporus on top of the roof terrace!

Reviews.Title: “Burckin brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Lesley E
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel, ideally situated on a quiet street but central to all the main attractions. The room, though small (which was not a problem for us) was very clean, well laid out and were were delighted with the little extras ie slippers and robes as well as the provision of shampoo etc. The breakfast was excellent, served on the roof terrace which provided great views over the city. Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful and we were pleased to use their taxe service. We were met at the airport (we landed at Sabiha Gokcen) and enjoyed a pleasant journey from the Asian side of the city. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Shelley V
Reviews.Content: We LOVED staying at the Burckin! It is a beautiful hotel, ideally located on a quiet street in the heart of Sultanahmet, within easy walking distance of the major sites and near 2 tram stops for going further afield. Nicely decorated, warm and friendly staff, great breakfast and an awesome view from the rooftop terrace/bar.The terrace was unfortunately under renovation while we were there, but the staff were very helpful in directing us to nearby hotels where we could enjoy an Efes with a view. We were given a choice of 2 rooms and took 405, which was larger than 404 next door. The staff went above and beyond in helping us track down lost luggage and were as excited as we were when it finally showed up!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Glenn A
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our stay. Can not beat the central location. Very good included breakfast. Wonderful view from the roof top terrace. We had three rooms. Two were very small (401 & 407) with bed up against the wall. Room 403 was larger with open space on both sides of the bed. Quiet side street just a block off main tram line.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is ideally located and is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Maribelfc28
Reviews.Content: Worth staying in this hotel, being close to many of the interesting things to visit and on a quiet street but next to the tram stops. People are really nice, from the cleaning lady to the kids breakfast. We spent some amazing days there and the incredible views from the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Erwan138
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, all major historical sites within 10 min walk. Excellent service and friendly staff, very helpfull. Clean rooms and good quality beds. Some double rooms are very small and should accomodate one person only. The roof terrace has an amazing view and comfortable furniture. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friedly staff, smallest rooms in the world”
Reviews.Author: Vallarbo
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent for all the major sites. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Roof terrace with a spectacular view. Quiet rooms. Good airport transport service. Clean and ok size bathroom with nice shower. But the room size was a big disapointment for a 4 star hotel in this price range. Booked a double room wich was so small that there was no room to move. The bed was under 2 m long and not wide enough for 2 persons, we slept very badly. Not enough room to hang clothes and no room to store luggage. Breakfast also poor.

Reviews.Title: “Burckin Hotel, Istanbul, Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Raghda B
Reviews.Content: our travel agent booked us at this hotel.Coming from the States and Texas in particular where everything is big, i was surprised at the size of the rooms but then i remembered that i am in Europe and that space is very precious especially in such an excellent and central location like Sultan Ahmet. Everything was within walking distance from the hotel. From the rooftop terrace we could enjoy the view of the blue mosque and the Aghia Sofia. The staff was extremely friendly and very professional;be it those at the front desk or those serving you breakfast on the terrace. The rooms were very clean and modern and apart from the small space that you get used to, they didn't lack anything in terms of comfort. We wanted some extra hangers and we had them within 5 mns. We had one light burnt out and again within 5 mns somebody was at the room changing it. You can tell that in this hotel they care to make their customer happy and to keep a very high standard. The last night we were surprised to find a plate of fresh fruit in our room for our breakfast since we had to leave very early at 3:30 AM and it was complimentory as well as our Turkish coffee that they did provide at 3:00 AM although the kitchen was closed. I would certainly recommend it to anybody visiting Istanbul and I would go back to it if I go back to Istanbul. Last but not least the price is very reasonable for the location and for the great service that's provided. Raghda from Houston

Reviews.Title: “Te Urutahi Aotearoa NZ”
Reviews.Author: Te Urutahi W
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this wonderful property and the beautiful people who hosted us that will do it justice. Our rooms were perfect and beautifully serviced everyday - the staff were highly professional and extremely helpful, breakfast on the roof terrace was exquisite and night-time turkish coffees as we overlooked the ancient city with twinkling lights was magical. Thank you all especially Seda and Ercon for your wonderful hospitality to Papa and I. We are very grateful and hope that you both will come and visit us in NZ one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, beautiful terrace”
Reviews.Author: MagmanSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on booking.com (16/09-20/09), it seemed nice, well located and quite affordable for the area. I noticed that reviewers were complaining about size of the rooms so I booked a double with balcony expecting a larger room and sent an e-mail right away to the hotel to ask them for a quite room in the upper floors. I also told them that as I'm suffering claustrophobia and ask them to avoid booking us a room with bed leaning against the wall (can absolutely not sleep facing the wall!!!). Hotel is brand new, open 4 months ago. Located in a street close to main Divan Yolu Caddesi (5 min. walk from "Sultanhamet" tram station. 5 min. walk from "Cemberlitas" tram station). 10min. walk from Aya Sofia, 5 min from Blue Mosque, 10min. from Grand Bazaar = Perfect location!!! We arrived at midnight due to delayed flight. We were first shown a extremely small room on 5th floor with bed leaning against the wall!!! I refused to stay and showed my booking to the bell boy and he immediately called reception saying that my booking was for a room w/balcony. I then spoke to the reception and they said that hotel was fully booked and no room with balcony available. He suggested us to check in in another room located on 3rd floor (302). This one was larger and after a quick look we decided to stay in this one. Reception offered to check with responsible the next morning to change room but we enjoyed our first night in that room so we kept it. The room had a nice overlooking to Aya Sofia! Good shower, nice toiletries (incl. toothbrushes, comb), bathrobe and slippers. Flat TV on the wall. Mini bar. Safe. No bed sheets but cotton blanket only (asked for an additional one). A/C was ok but we preferred sleeping with open window. The breakfast is served on the roof which is extremely pleasant but can be very hot due to lack of sunshades (25Â°C at 9:00am)! Breakfast choice was about the same everyday but wasn't a problem for us. Depending on the time you will show up to take your breakfast, terrace might be crowded and no seats available (breakfast 7:30-10:00) but it only occured once (we took our breakfast between 8:45-9:30 almost everyday). The terrace is THE big asset of this hotel, the view is incredible and is perfect to relax after a long day of visits around the city. Staff was nice. All in all, I would recommend this hotel and would stay again. NB : There is a big bunch of stairs down to reception from the street as well as to reach the rooftop, it might not be recommended to persons who have mobility problems.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: NettyKo
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Istanbul,so didn't really know what to expect in terms of the hotels. I chosed Burckin cause the room rates were decent and location seemed ok. The reality was much better than I expected! The location is just excellent - in the heart of the Old Town, just a few meters away from main attractions such as Blue Mosque, Haga Sophia or Grand Bazaar, but it is located in one of the quiet back-streets so you have the feeling of being in the center, same time not too busy/noisy! The staff is great, very helpful and can really give great advice on resturants. My room was very small indeed but very clean and really nicely decorated. Huge and comfortable bed, shower with jacuzzi options :) The absolute highlight is the roof tarace... amazing view on the Bosphorous and Blue Mosque. Great breakfasts and relatively cheap drinks. I can highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: fsnomad
Reviews.Content: The rooms are cozy, but quite comfortable. The staff is most accommodating. Being American, I like a top sheet on the bed... they brought 2 extras. The rooftop terrace breakfasts were consistently good. The views from our room and the rooftop were stunning! Located 5 minutes from the tram running through Sultanahmet, 3 minutes from very good restaurants and tourist shopping, less than a 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. A wonderful 5 night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Nermin Z
Reviews.Content: This hotel has come as a lovely surprise. Lovely service, amazing location and the most smiley and helpful staff that i have encountered anywhere in the world. Adam and his team has made our trip a joy. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to have a hassle free trip to Istanbul. Thank you for the lovely time guys

Reviews.Title: “very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: VolosTina
Reviews.Content: The position of the hotel was very good, the rooms was very - very small. We had two rooms in the back side of the hotel wich were awfull, very small. The breakfast was good, but be carefull dont order an extra coffee, very expensinve, 7 euro a cup. Overall was very clean and the stuff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Denise M
Reviews.Content: small boutique hotel in sultanahmet- great for sightseeing- very close to grand bazaar, aya sofia, blue mosque, etc- small rooms, but great prices- fabulous rooftop terrace run by Can with amazing views

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: albert b
Reviews.Content: it is very nice hotel with a fantastic view, rooms are very new and very clean. staff is very polite. i am very happy to stay in Burckin Hotel. Also there is a roof with a view of old Istanbul. I advice everybody to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “UNFORGETTABLE VÄ°EW , EXCELLENT HOSPÄ°TALÄ°TY”
Reviews.Author: yusuf21
Reviews.Content: I went there with my girlfirend.The view of the room and especially of the restaurant/bar was unforgettable. It was the best boutique hotelI had ever been in Ä°stanbul regarding price-service-view and quality verification. The mix of tradition-history-modernism in decoration is another charming quality of this hotel. You are a few seconds to all historic fortune of Ä°stanbul (Aya Sofia-Blue Mosque-Grand Bazaar). I highly recommend this warm place to every traveller whick road pass from the heart of Ä°stanbul Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “A great value which turns business trip into pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Kalyoncu
Reviews.Content: I've stayed recently in this wonderful, cozy hotel. It was a great experience. Breakfast/meals are served at the terrace with a terrific view overlooking the historical scenes of the city. The rooms are perfectly clean, all the amenities are very well thought through and very useful. The location is at the heart of the history.
